greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Inverse Moebius transform of bigomega(n).
comment: a(n) is the total number of prime factors (counted with multiplicity) over all the divisors of n. - _Geoffrey Critzer_, Feb 03 2015
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: G.f.: Sum_{k>=1} bigomega(k)*x^k/(1 - x^k). - _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, Feb 19 2017
example: a(12)=9 because the divisors of 12 are: 1,2,3,4,6,12 and the number (with multiplicity) of prime factors of these divisors is: 0+1+1+2+2+3=9. - _Geoffrey Critzer_, Feb 03 2015
results.author: _Benoit Cloitre_, Apr 19 2002
